channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Wall Street’s bull run reaches a make-or-break week as Trump-Xi talks and Fed decisions loom
item.description: The S&P 500 has shot up a stunning 37% since hitting a low in April.

item.title: Skyrocketing valuations, revenues, and investments: ‘That sounds like a tech story. It’s a women’s sports story,’ Alexis Ohanian says
item.description: Women’s sports revenue is expected to hit a record-breaking $2.35 billion this year.

item.title: Qualcomm CEO warns that ‘everybody’s playing to win’ when it comes to an AI bubble—but it’s still too early to tell who will succeed
item.description: Cristiano Amon says AI’s long-term potential is being underestimated, even as growing hype and soaring valuations spark comparisons to the dot-com bub...

item.title: Syria’s only female minister on what she says to her new president about hiring women: ‘quotas are so important’
item.description: "Syria is a mosaic," H.E. Hind Kabawat told Fortune, herself a member of the Christian minority and an exile from the country for some 14 years.

item.title: Kendra Scott says she launched her billion-dollar business from her bedroom with just $500 when she was pregnant with her first son
item.description: Scott started at the bottom, but is now one of the few women in the U.S. to have founded a billion-dollar company.

item.title: How Trump’s ballroom will cost American taxpayers up to $110 million
Economic calendar: Consumer-confidence and Case-Shiller housing updates upcoming
Argentina ETF surges 16% after Javier Milei's party outperforms polls,
